National Association of educational Broadcasters
1346 CONNECTICUT AVENUE
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
WILLIAM G. HARLEY April 22, 1963
PRESIDENT
Miss Marion E. Corwell
Dearborn Public Schools
Office of Public Relations
5757 Neckel Avenue
Dearborn, Michigan
Dear Marion:
I had a letter from Frances Butler of the American
Association of University Women, saying that she has
decided to resign from the Public Relations Committee.
She said that she never had been active and furthermore
the AAUW was giving up its Department of Mass Media.
I cannot lay my hands on the letter in which you
recommended some additions to your Committee, so let me
know your choice of a replacement and I will make the
appointment.
I also enclose a copy of a brochure put out by the
ASAE. Perhaps we should be turning out something of
this nature as a promotional piece for the membership
recruitment. Your Committee could work closely with the
Membership Committee in developing such a brochure. It
need not be quite so fancy but still ought to be attracÂ¬
tive. What do you think?
WGH: jms
Enclosure
P, S. We have lots of letters from which we could extract
quotes on the value of the organization.
